description: Getting help with directions, and repaying the favor.
title: One Mother to Another
title_page: One Mother to Another - The New York Times
text:
Dear Diary:
It was late, and I was lost in the East Village. I was on my way to an opening at a small art gallery. I didnâ€™t have my iPhone; even if I had, I never would have found the place.
I asked a young man for help. He was probably in his mid-20s. He found the appropriate map on his phone and showed me the way.
When he saw that I was having difficulty following his directions, he offered to escort me. I thanked him profusely, and when we arrived at the gallery I told him to tell his mother, from me, that she had raised a lovely son.
He asked if I would tell her. I said I would be delighted to.
He dialed her number, and told her that he was with someone who wanted to talk to her. He put me on the phone, and she and I had a lovely conversation.
